Process.Name: 5.3 Define Scope
Process.Objective: This process develops a description of the project and resulting product or service. It describes the boundaries and acceptance criteria for this product, service, or result.

Task.Text: Gather the existing scope definitions from the Initiation stage of the project.|~|- Project Charter|~|- Project Management Plan|~|- Scope Management Plan
Review the existing project information and context.|~|- Risk and Requirements documentation|~|- Organizational Environmental factors|~|- Existing process assets

Describe the use, characteristics, and any other relevant aspects of the product to be delivered.|~|Approaches to doing this include:|~|- Product breakdown,|~|- Requirements analysis,|~|- Systems analysis,|~|- Systems engineering,|~|- Value analysis, and|~|- Value engineering.

Write the Project Scope Statement. This contains more detail than the Project Charter and covers these areas:|~||~|Product scope description. |~|- This describes the characteristics of the product, service, or project outcome as outlines in the charter and requirements documents|~||~|Deliverables|~|- Any defined and verifiable product, service, capability or outcome required to complete a process, phase or project. This includes reports and documents that form part of the process execution.|~||~|Acceptance criteria|~|The conditions that are required to be met in order for deliverables to be accepted.|~||~|Project exclusions|~|Clarifies those things that are excluded from the project.
